action.action-desc: Mr. Bentivolio introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to require public disclosure of the method used to calculate consumer credit scores and inclusion of debt settlement agreements in consumer reports.

section.header: Public disclosure of method used to calculate consumer credit scores

subparagraph.text: by striking that— and all that follows through if the consumer and inserting that, if the consumer;
in subparagraph (A), by striking ; and and inserting a period; and

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (f)(5) to read as follows:

paragraph.header: Public disclosure of credit score methodology
paragraph.text: Any person who develops a tool or system for deriving a credit score shall make such tool or system available to the public, including on such person’s website.

section.header: Requirement for furnishers of information to report debt settlement

paragraph.header: Duty to provide notice of debt settlement
paragraph.text: A person who furnishes information to a consumer reporting agency with respect to a debt of a consumer shall, if the person enters into a settlement agreement with the consumer with respect to such debt, notify the consumer reporting agency of such agreement within 30 days of such agreement.
